attrs.description: This attribute helps you specify the input date format for all the dates in your XML. This is a mandatory attribute to specify and once specified, all the dates in your XML data should conform to the format specified herein.
attrs.name: dateFormat

attrs.description: You can also specify how the dates look on your Gantt chart using this attribute. This attribute takes the output date format as string. You can build your own output date format string as explained in the section "Configuring date formats".
attrs.name: outputDateFormat

attrs.description: If you want your Gantt pane to scroll through a specified time line, you can use this attribute to set what timeline the pane will represent. For example, if you want your Gantt pane to show date only for 3 months and then scroll the rest, you can set this attribute as 3. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling".
attrs.name: ganttPaneDuration

attrs.description: If you've opted to scroll the Gantt pane, this attribute lets you choose the unit of your specified duration. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling".
attrs.name: ganttPaneDurationUnit

attrs.description: Whether to show full names of the process labels and data columns in grid. If you set this as on, the labels will not wrap and always show in full. When required, a scroll bar will automatically appear for the entire grid.
attrs.name: showFullDataTable

attrs.description: You can opt to set the width of the Gantt view pane in percent using this attribute. The rest of the width will be taken by the grid. If the data grid takes lesser space, the chart will automatically adjust the Gantt pane to assume more width.
attrs.name: ganttWidthPercent

attrs.description: If you want the chart to never automatically adjust the Gantt width and stick to the percent width that you've specified, you can set this attribute to 1.
attrs.name: forceGanttWidthPercent

attrs.description: Caption for the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption for the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

attrs.description: For each task bar in the Gantt chart, you can show its respective start date on its left. To do so, set this attribute as 1.
attrs.name: showTaskStartDate

attrs.description: For each task bar in the Gantt chart, you can show its end date value too by setting this attribute as 1.
attrs.name: showTaskEndDate

attrs.description: Whether to show task labels for each task bar in the Gantt chart. The task labels show up only if they've been defined for the task.
attrs.name: showTaskLabels

attrs.description: If you've used the percentage task feature, you can opt to show the percent complete for each task as part of the task label by setting this attribute as 1.
attrs.name: showPercentLabel

attrs.description: If you've used the percentage task feature, you can opt to show the slack (percent of work not completed) as either a filled bar or empty bar. To draw as empty bars, set this attribute as 0.
attrs.name: showSlackAsFill

attrs.description: If you've opted to fill the slack bars with color, you can define the color code for the same here.
attrs.name: slackFillColor

attrs.description: Whether to animate the chart while rendering? If you define this attribute as 0, even your custom defined Style animations will not work.
attrs.name: animation

attrs.description:
This attribute sets the animation duration of the chart. `animationDuration` attribute is applicable only if animation of the chart is enabled. 

Default value: 1 sec
attrs.name: animationDuration

attrs.description: Click URL for the entire chart. The entire chart can then act as a hotspot. This URL can be provided in FusionCharts Link format.
attrs.name: clickURL

attrs.description:
Sets whether the `clickURL` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when the chart is clicked) overrides the `link` attribute (that sets a link to which the user is directed when a data plot is clicked). 

Default value: 0 (`clickURL` does not override `link`)
attrs.name: clickURLOverridesPlotLinks

attrs.description: If you set this attribute as 1, the Gantt pane grid will take the same background and border properties as that of the last category (visual dateline) defined.
attrs.name: extendCategoryBg

attrs.description: Whether to show "Print Chart" item in the context menu of the chart? Even if you opt to hide the item in context menu, you can still opt to invoke `print()` JavaScript method of the chart to print the same.
attrs.name: showPrintMenuItem

attrs.description: Chart will automatically scroll to the given date at the time of rendering. This attribute will only work when `ganttPaneDuration` and `ganttPaneDurationUnit` attributes are set as per requirement. This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
attrs.name: scrollToDate

attrs.description: Whether to display the vertical scroll bar or not. By default, the attribute is set to 1 and the vertical scroll bar appears depending on the height of the chart. More of this has been explained in the section "Enable scrolling". This feature is supported by JavaScript Gantt chart only.
attrs.name: useVerticalScrolling

attrs.description: When the process rows do not occupy the complete height of the chart, this attribute is used to specify the row height configuration. If set to true, each row is set to its own height. Otherwise, the rows occupy the total available height equally. Default value is false.
attrs.name: forceRowHeight

attrs.description: Drag-able charts of PowerCharts XT pack allow you to configure each dataset as drag-able or non-drag-able using this attribute. Your end users will only be able to change the data belonging to drag-able datasets.
attrs.name: allowDrag

attrs.description: This attribute updates the actual start date / actual end date columns when taskbars are dragged.
attrs.name: autoUpdateStartEndDateColumn

attrs.description: This attribute allows taskbars to be dragged over adjacent ones, enabling visual overlap when they occur at the same time or overlapping periods.
attrs.name: allowTaskbarOverlap

description: These attributes let you control a variety of functional elements on the chart. For example, you can opt to show/hide data labels, data values. You can also set chart limits and extended properties.

description: These attributes let you set and configure custom chart messages, using text as well as images. These attributes are supported in FusionCharts constructor (`FusionCharts({ })`).

attrs.description: Caption of the chart.
attrs.name: caption

attrs.description: Sub-caption of the chart.
attrs.name: subCaption

description: Using these attributes, you can set the various headings and titles of chart like caption, sub-caption.

attrs.description: Sets horizontal alignment of caption
attrs.name: captionAlignment

attrs.description: Whether caption should be on top of the data plot area
attrs.name: captionOnTop

attrs.description: Sets the caption font size in pixels. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: captionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font size (in pixels). Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: subCaptionFontSize

attrs.description: Sets the caption font family
attrs.name: captionFont

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font family
attrs.name: subCaptionFont

attrs.description: Sets the caption font color
attrs.name: captionFontColor

attrs.description: Sets the sub-caption font color
attrs.name: subCaptionFontColor

attrs.description: Whether the caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: captionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the sub caption font should be displayed in bold
attrs.name: subCaptionFontBold

attrs.description: Whether the caption is aligned with the canvas. Else, it will be aligned with the entire chart area
attrs.name: alignCaptionWithCanvas

attrs.description:
If caption is not centre aligned, lets you configure the padding (in pixels) from either edge.
Will be ignored if caption is centre aligned.
attrs.name: captionHorizontalPadding

attrs.description: This attribute, when set to __1__, indicates to the chart that the text (rendered on the chart) may contain RTL characters and the textual display has to be managed accordingly.
attrs.name: hasRTLText

attrs.description:
This attribute lets you enable/disable the highlight effect, in the form of a `fadeout`, for the data plots corresponding to a legend item. When this attribute is enabled and the mouse pointer is hovered over a legend item label, plots belonging to the other data series fadeout, by reducing their opacity.

 The fadeout effect can be customized by specifying the fadeout color and opacity using the `color` and `alpha` attributes. Eg. `fadeout|color=#ff0000, alpha=60`
attrs.name: plotHighlightEffect

attrs.description: This attribute changes the theme of the chart. There are 7 types of themes which have been made according to the different color combinations.
attrs.name: theme

description: These attributes let you configure the cosmetics of chart caption and sub-caption.

attrs.description: Which pre-defined color palette to use
attrs.name: palette

attrs.description: If you want your own palette derived from a particular hex color, you can specify the same here. All other colors on the chart will automatically derive from that palette.
attrs.name: paletteThemeColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: `FF5904, FFFFFF`. Remember to remove # and any spaces in between.
attrs.name: bgColor

attrs.description: Sets the alpha (transparency) for the background. If you've opted for gradient background, you need to set a list of alpha(s) separated by comma.
attrs.name: bgAlpha

attrs.description: If you've opted for a gradient background, this attribute lets you set the ratio of each color constituent.
attrs.name: bgRatio

attrs.description: Angle of the background color, in case of a gradient.
attrs.name: bgAngle

attrs.description: Whether to show a border around the chart or not?
attrs.name: showBorder

attrs.description: Border color of the chart.
attrs.name: borderColor

attrs.description: Border thickness of the chart.
attrs.name: borderThickness

attrs.description: Border alpha of the chart.
attrs.name: borderAlpha

attrs.description: To place any image (JPG/PNG/GIF) as background of the chart, enter the (path and) name of the background image. It should be in the same domain as the chart.
attrs.name: bgImage

attrs.description: This attribute specifies the opacity for the loaded background image.
attrs.name: bgImageAlpha

attrs.description: Helps you specify the mode in which the background image is to be displayed. Stretch - expands the image to fit the entire chart area, without maintaining original image constraints. Tile - the image is repeated as a pattern on the entire chart area. Fit - fits the image proportionately on the chart area. Fill -proportionately fills the entire chart area with the image. Center - the image is positioned at the center of the chart area. None - Default mode.
attrs.name: bgImageDisplayMode

attrs.description: Helps you to vertically align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageVAlign

attrs.description: Helps you to horizontally align the background image.
attrs.name: bgImageHAlign

attrs.description: Helps you magnify the background image.This attribute will only work when the attribute `bgImageDisplayMode` is set to none, center, or tile.
attrs.name: bgImageScale

attrs.description:
This attribute if set to _1_, shows a border around the canvas of the chart. 

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: showcanvasborder

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background color for the chart canvas. You can set any hex color code as the value of this attribute. To specify a gradient as canvas background color, separate the hex color codes of each color in the gradient using comma. Example: #FF5904, #FFFFFF.
attrs.name: canvasBgColor

attrs.description: This attribute sets the background transparency for the chart canvas. For gradient, separate the alpha value using comma. Example: 15, 50.
attrs.name: canvasBgAlpha

attrs.description: When a gradient is used to set the color of the canvas background, this attribute sets the ratio of the colors. Example : If the value of the `canvasBgColor` attribute is set as `#FF5904, #FFFFFF`, `canvasBgRatio` can be used to specify their ratio in the background.
attrs.name: canvasBgRatio

attrs.description: Helps you specify canvas background angle in case of gradient.
attrs.name: canvasBgAngle

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border color.
attrs.name: canvasBorderColor

attrs.description: Lets you specify canvas border thickness.
attrs.name: canvasBorderThickness

attrs.description: Lets you control transparency of canvas border.
attrs.name: canvasBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Lets you specify the color in which the grid border for the Gantt pane view will be drawn.
attrs.name: ganttLineColor

attrs.description: Alpha for the grid border of Gantt view pane.
attrs.name: ganttLineAlpha

attrs.description: Color for the data grid border.
attrs.name: gridBorderColor

attrs.description: Alpha for the data grid border.
attrs.name: gridBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Color for the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid.
attrs.name: gridResizeBarColor

attrs.description: Thickness of the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid,
attrs.name: gridResizeBarThickness

attrs.description: Alpha of the drag line that appears when resizing the data grid.
attrs.name: gridResizeBarAlpha

attrs.description: If you want your task bars to be rounded (when not using percent complete feature), you can set the radius of the round corner here. That'll result in all task bars having rounded corners.
attrs.name: taskBarRoundRadius

attrs.description: This attribute lets you specify the gradient fill formula for the task bars. Example: `{light-10},{light-20},{light-60}`
attrs.name: taskBarFillMix

attrs.description: If you're using gradient fill formula for the task bars, this attribute lets you specify the ratio for each color in the gradient.
attrs.name: taskBarFillRatio

attrs.description: Global font face for all text on the chart. You can individually customize font properties of each element using their respective attributes or Styles.
attrs.name: baseFont

attrs.description: Global font size for all text on the chart. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: baseFontSize

attrs.description: Global font color for all text on the chart.
attrs.name: baseFontColor

attrs.description: Whether to apply the shadow effect for the task bars?
attrs.name: showShadow

attrs.description: You can load an external logo (JPEG/PNG) to your chart, this attribute lets you specify the URL. Due to cross domain security restrictions it is advised to use a logo from the same domain name as your charts.
attrs.name: logoURL

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on the left side of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoLeftMargin

attrs.description: This attribute helps you set the amount of empty space that you want to put on top of your logo image. Nothing is rendered in this space.
attrs.name: logoTopMargin

attrs.description: Where to position the logo on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: logoPosition

attrs.description: Once the logo has loaded on the chart, you can configure its opacity using this attribute.
attrs.name: logoAlpha

attrs.description: You can also change the size of externally loaded logo at run-time by specifying a value for this parameter.
attrs.name: logoScale

attrs.description: If you want to link the logo to an external URL, specify the link in this attribute. The link can be in FusionCharts link format, allowing you to link to new windows, pop-ups, frames etc.
attrs.name: logoLink

attrs.description: Setting this attribute to 1, you can allow the chart to automatically resize itself when the parent container of the chart is resized.
attrs.name: manageResize

attrs.description: When enabled in AUTO mode, long data labels are truncated by adding ellipses to prevent them from overflowing the chart background. The default value is 1.
attrs.name: useEllipsesWhenOverflow

description: The following attributes let you configure chart cosmetics like background color, background alpha, canvas color & alpha etc.

attrs.description: Whether to show tooltip for the chart?
attrs.name: showToolTip

attrs.description: Background color for the tooltip
attrs.name: toolTipBgColor

attrs.description: Font color for the tool-tip.
attrs.name: toolTipColor

attrs.description: Border Color for the tooltip.
attrs.name: toolTipBorderColor

attrs.description: Sets the border transparency for tool tip.
attrs.name: tooltipBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Whether to show starting and ending date for each task in tooltip?
attrs.name: dateInToolTip

attrs.description: Whether to show shadow for tooltips.
attrs.name: showToolTipShadow

attrs.description:
Specify custom text for the tooltip 

 You can either specify a constant string as the tooltip text or you can use variable values from the data level by prefixing a __$__ to the attribute name, for example, __$name__, __$value__.
attrs.name: plottooltext

attrs.description: Configure the tooltip's position.
attrs.name: tooltipPosition

description: These attributes let you control the tooltip. You can set the background color, border color, separator character and few other details.

attrs.description: Where to position the toolbar on the chart: TL - Top-left TR - Top-right BR - Bottom right BL - Bottom left CC - Center of screen
attrs.name: toolbarPosition

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to x-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarX

attrs.description: Sets the toolbox position on the chart with respect to y-axis.
attrs.name: toolbarY

attrs.description: Sets the horizontal alignment of the toolbar on the chart.
attrs.name: toolbarHAlign

attrs.description: Sets the vertical alignment of the toolbar on the chart
attrs.name: toolbarVAlign

attrs.description: Sets the color of the toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonColor

attrs.description: Enables/disables display of tooltips for toolbar buttons.
attrs.name: showToolBarButtonTooltext

attrs.description: You can change the scale of the toolbar by specifying a value for this attribute.
attrs.name: toolbarButtonScale

description: Using this set of attributes, you can customize the toolbar on the chart. The advantage of having a toolbar is that it manages all the UI action elements (context menus, checkboxes, buttons) centrally. This provides a clean, uniform look and a better, more meaningful and logical grouping.

attrs.description:
Whether the chart will allow exporting to images, PDFs, SVG, XLSX or CSV format.  

__Default value__: 0
attrs.name: exportEnabled

attrs.description:
In case of server-side exporting, the action specifies whether the exported image will be sent back to client as download, or whether it'll be saved on the server. 

__Default value__: download
attrs.name: exportAction

attrs.description: In case of server side exporting, this refers to the path of the server-side export handler (the ready-to-use scripts that we provide).
attrs.name: exportHandler

attrs.description: Lets you configure what output formats to allow for export of chart, in the export context menu, and also customize the label for each menu item. The attribute value should be a pipe (|) delimited separated key-value pair. Example: `exportFormats: 'PNG=Export as High Quality Image|JPG|PDF=Export as PDF File'`
attrs.name: exportFormats

attrs.description:
This attributes sets the modes of export. To enable client-side exporting, set this attribute to __client__. 

__Default value__: auto. 

__Note__: Starting v3.12.1, the `exportMode` attribute replaces the `exportAtClientSide` attribute. However, you dont need to make any changes to the existing setup because, the FusionCharts library comes with the proper mapping already provided.
attrs.name: exportMode

attrs.description: Whether the menu items related to export (e.g., Save as JPEG etc.) will appear in the context menu of chart.

description: The following attributes help you control chart margins and paddings. FusionCharts Suite XT allows you to manually customize the padding of various elements on the chart to allow advanced manipulation and control over chart visualization. Padding in FusionCharts Suite XT is always defined in pixels, unless the attribute itself suggests some other scale (like `plotSpacePercent`, which configures the spacing using percentage values). You can also define the chart margins. Chart Margins refer to the empty space left on the top, bottom, left and right of the chart. It's not necessary for you to specify any padding/margin values. FusionCharts Suite XT automatically assumes the best values for the same, if you do not specify the same.

description:
Processes on a Gantt chart are created and customized using the `processes` object and its child object, the `process` object. You can show team members, projects, or task lists as a process on a Gantt chart. Processes are shown in the first column of the scrollable data table of the Gantt chart.

The `processes` object is used to group together all processes for a Gantt chart. Using this attribute, cosmetic properties for all processes can be collectively specified. Additionally, it is also used to create and customize a process header (the first cell of the column that shows the processes).

These attributes let you customize all processes and the process header.

description:
The `process` object represents individual processes on a Gantt chart. While the `processes` object groups all processes together, it is mandatory to use a `process` object to create a process.

If the `processes` object is used to configure an attribute globally for all processes, the `process` object can override that property for an individual process.

These attributes let you create and customize individual processes using the `process` object.

description:
Additional data for processes/tasks in a Gantt chart can be shown using a data table.

Data tables in a Gantt chart are created and customized using the `dataTable`, `dataColumn` (child of `dataTable`), and the `text` (child of `dataColumn`) objects.

The `dataTable` object is used to create this table and collectively configure all the columns and cells in these tables. This object is also used to define header(s) for the added data columns.

These attributes let you create and configure the data table.

attrs.name: width

description:
The `dataColumn` object represents individual columns in a data table. It is also used to collectively customize all the cells in a column.

While the `dataTable` object creates the framework of a table, it is mandatory to use a `dataColumn` object to create a column. 

If the `dataTable` object is used to configure an attribute globally for all columns, the `dataColumn` object can override that property for individual columns. It can also override the header properties configured for the columns.

These attributes let you create and configure columns for the data table.

description:
The `text` object represents individual cells in the data table. While the `dataColumn` object adds a column to the framework created by the `dataTable` object, it is mandatory to use the `text` object to add cells to the columns.

If the `dataTable`/`dataColumn` objects are used to configure an attribute globally for all cells, the `text` object can override that property for individual cells.

These attributes let you create and configure individual cells for the columns in the data table.

description:
Connectors, for connecting two chart elements, can be created and customized using the `connectors` object and its child object, the `connector` object.

The `connectors` object groups together all the connectors on a chart.

These attributes let you customize all connectors collectively.

description:
Each `connector` object represents a connector that connects two tasks.

The `connector` object represents individual connectors on a chart. While the `connectors` object can collectively customize the connectors, it is mandatory to use a `connector` object to create a connector.

If the `connectors` object is used to configure an attribute globally for all connectors, the `connector` object can override that property for individual connectors.

These attributes let you create and customize individual connectors.

description:
The `milestone` object is used to represent individual milestones.

While the `milestones` object groups all milestones, it is mandatory to use the `milestone` object to create individual milestones.

If the `milestones` object is used to configure an attribute globally for all milestones, the `milestone` object can override that property for an individual milestone.

These attributes let you create and customize individual milestones using the `milestone` object.

description:
Trend-lines are vetical lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. The `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object is used to add trend-lines to a chart.

Although the `line` object has to be defined within the `trendlines` object, the latter cannot be used to collectively customize trend-lines, because it does not have any attributes of its own.

The attributes of the `lines` object, child of the `trendlines` object, are used to create and customize trend-lines for charts.

attrs.description: Sets color of all the trend lines and its associated text in the chart.
attrs.name: trendlineColor

attrs.description: If you've opted to show the trend as a line, this attribute lets you define the thickness of all the trend lines in your chart.
attrs.name: trendlineThickness

attrs.description: Sets transparency for all the trend lines in your charts.
attrs.name: trendlineAlpha

attrs.description: Sets the tooltip text of the trend-line. It accepts macros, plain text, and HTML tags, as string.
attrs.name: trendLineToolText

attrs.description: Whether all the trend line/zone will be displayed over data plots or under them.
attrs.name: showTrendlinesOnTop

description:
Trend-lines are vertical lines that aid in interpretation of data with respect to some pre-determined value. For example, if you are plotting the sales data for the current year, you might want to show the previous year's average monthly sales as a trend indicator for ease of comparison. Cosmetics for all the trend-lines rendered can be attained using this set of attributes.

Although there are set of attributes of the `line object`, used to create and customize trend-lines, these set of attributes effect all the trend-lines rendered in your chart.

attrs.description: Sets the font family for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueFont

attrs.description: Sets the font size for the trend-line display value. Besides pixels (px) values can also be defined in rem, %, em, and vw.
attrs.name: trendValueFontSize

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be bold formatted. 

Default value: 0 (not bold formatted)
attrs.name: trendValueFontBold

attrs.description:
Sets whether the trend-line display value will be italicized. 

Default value: 0 (not italicized)
attrs.name: trendValueFontItalic

attrs.description: Sets the background color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBgColor

attrs.description: Sets the border color for the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderColor

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the background of the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBgAlpha

attrs.description:
Sets the transparency for the border around the trend-line display value. 

Default value: 100
attrs.name: trendValueBorderAlpha

attrs.description: Sets padding for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderPadding

attrs.description: Sets the radius for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderRadius

attrs.description: Sets the thickness for the border around the trend-line display value.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderThickness

attrs.description:
Whether the border around the trend-line display value should be rendered as dashed lines. 

__Default value__: 0 (border rendered using straight lines)
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashed

attrs.description: Sets the length of each dash when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashLen

attrs.description: Sets the gap between two consecutive dashes when the border around the trend-line display value is rendered as dashed lines.
attrs.name: trendValueBorderDashGap

description:
These attributes let you customize the text displayed with a trend-line. 

__Note__: These attributes belong to the `chart` object and  not to the `line` object (child of the `trendline` object). They are, therefore, applied to all trend-lines on your chart.

table: The item Object (child of legend Object)

attrs.description: Color code for the legend item
attrs.name: color

attrs.description:
Label for the legend item. 

 __Note__: The `label` attribute replaces the `name` attribute. Previously, either one of the attributes could be used to set the label. Support for the `name` attribute has been discontinued since v3.10.0.
attrs.name: label

description:
A legend in the Gantt chart can be configured using the `legend` object and its child object, the `item` object.

The `color` attribute of the `legend` object is used to set a common color for all legend items.

These attributes of the `item` object are used to configure individual legend items.
